meanings.definition: A person who is habitually drunk.
meanings.sent1: The drunkard stumbled down the street, unable to walk straight.
meanings.sent2: The town drunkard was always seen at the local bar.
meanings.sent3: The drunkard tried to dance on the table but ended up falling off comically.
meanings.sent4: His addiction to alcohol turned him into a shadow of the man he used to be, a mere drunkard.
meanings.sent5: The image of the drunkard swaying with a bottle in hand was etched in her memory.

meanings.sent1: The young drunkard often found himself in trouble after a night of heavy drinking.
meanings.sent2: She was known as the party drunkard among her friends.
meanings.sent3: The drunkard mistook a lamppost for a person and tried to have a conversation with it.
meanings.sent4: His reckless behavior at the party labeled him as the town's infamous drunkard.
meanings.sent5: The smell of alcohol always lingered around the drunkard, giving away his habits.
